revised_title: Quantitative Analysis of Regenerating Liver and Tissue Culture
tldr: The authors investigated the growth of cell populations and the properties of regenerating liver in rats using tissue culture. They found that different types of cells, including parenchymal, bile-duct, and sinusoid lining cells, participate in the regeneration process. The study suggests that increased mobility of cells during regeneration may play a crucial role in the regenerative process.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
